org.seedstack.kafka

Interface ConsumerListener<K,V>


  • public interface ConsumerListener<K,V>

    Implement this interface to listen asynchronously to records using a Kafka consumer. By annotating the implementing class with KafkaListener, the underlying consumer will be automatically subscribed to the specified topics.

    The underlying Kafka consumer will be automatically started and stopped with the application. A unhandled failure will gracefully stop the consumer and a later attempt will be rescheduled.

    If the implementing class also implements ConsumerRebalanceListener, it will be used as the rebalance listener for the underlying consumer. If the implementing class also implements OffsetCommitCallback, it will be used as a callback during the asynchronous commits.

      This method is called when some ConsumerRecords are available.
      default void onException(Exception e)
      This method is called when an exception occurs during consumer polling or message processing in onConsumerRecords(ConsumerRecords).

      • onConsumerRecords

        default void onConsumerRecords(org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.ConsumerRecords<K,V> records)
        This method is called when some ConsumerRecords are available.
        Parameters:
        records - the just-polled consumer records.

      • onException

        default void onException(Exception e)
                  throws Exception
        This method is called when an exception occurs during consumer polling or message processing in onConsumerRecords(ConsumerRecords).
        Parameters:
        e - the exception that occurred.
        Throws:
        Exception - rethrow an exception to trigger a graceful stop and a retry after the specified delay.
